GameDBLocalizedString.Text: カテコールアミン血液検査 - サンプリング
カテコールアミン血液検査は、体内のカテコラミンの量を測定する検査です。「カテコールアミン」とは、ドーパミン、ノルエピネフリン、エピネフリンというホルモンの総称です。 \n\n必要な検査室: 血液検査室
カテコールアミン血液検査 - 検査
カテコールアミン血液検査は、体内のカテコラミンの量を測定する検査です。「カテコールアミン」とは、ドーパミン、ノルエピネフリン、エピネフリンというホルモンの総称です。
がん抗原（CA）検査 - サンプリング

がん抗原（CA）検査は、ある種のがんの診断と管理に用いられる血液検査です。腫瘍マーカーとは、がんの増殖に反応して、あるいはがん組織そのものによって体内で生成される物質で、通常はタンパク質のことです。腫瘍マーカーには、ある種のがんに特異的なものもあれば、複数の種類のがんに認められるものもあります。よく知られたマーカーの多くは、がんだけでなく、がんでない状態でも見られます。そのため、この検査のみをがんの特定に使用することはできません。 \n\n必要な検査室: 血液検査室
がん抗原（CA）検査 - 検査

がん抗原（CA）検査は、ある種のがんの診断と管理に用いられる血液検査です。腫瘍マーカーとは、がんの増殖に反応して、あるいはがん組織そのものによって体内で生成される物質で、通常はタンパク質のことです。腫瘍マーカーには、ある種のがんに特異的なものもあれば、複数の種類のがんに認められるものもあります。よく知られたマーカーの多くは、がんだけでなく、がんでない状態でも見られます。そのため、この検査のみをがんの特定に使用することはできません。
大腸内視鏡検査
大腸内視鏡検査は、がんや大腸ポリープなど、腸の中の異常を調べるために行われる医療行為です。大腸内視鏡検査は、大腸内視鏡（内視鏡の一種）と呼ばれる器具、すなわちカメラと照明の入った細長く柔軟なチューブを用いて行われます。
尿中抗原検査 - サンプリング
尿中に含まれるがん由来の抗原の量を調べる尿検査です。さまざまな病原体から排出された抗原が腎臓で濃縮されて尿中に排泄されることを利用し、尿中抗原検査を行うことで、迅速に検査結果を得ることができます。 \n\n必要な検査室: 組織検査室
尿中抗原検査 - 検査
尿中に含まれるがん由来の抗原の量を調べる尿検査です。さまざまな病原体から排出された抗原が腎臓で濃縮されて尿中に排泄されることを利用し、尿中抗原検査を行うことで、迅速に検査結果を得ることができます。
骨髄生検 - サンプリング
骨髄生検では、骨髄の構造を保存した円柱状のコア試料を採取します。生検試料は専門医によって評価され、細胞の量、骨髄の他の成分の量との比較、異なる細胞系列が十分な数で存在するかどうか、骨髄に異常な浸潤があるかどうかが判断されます。 \n\n必要な検査室: 組織検査室
骨髄生検 - 検査
骨髄生検では、骨髄の構造を保存した円柱状のコア試料を採取します。生検試料は専門医によって評価され、細胞の量、骨髄の他の成分の量との比較、異なる細胞系列が十分な数で存在するかどうか、骨髄に異常な浸潤があるかどうかが判断されます。
フローサイトメトリー - サンプリング
フローサイトメトリーとは、細胞や粒子の集団の物理的・化学的特性を検出・測定するための計測技術です。細胞や粒子を含む試料を液体に分散させ、フローサイトメーターの装置に注入し、光学的に観察します。\n\n必要な検査室: 血液検査室
フローサイトメトリー - 検査
フローサイトメトリーとは、細胞や粒子の集団の物理的・化学的特性を検出・測定するための計測技術です。細胞や粒子を含む試料を液体に分散させ、フローサイトメーターの装置に注入し、光学的に観察します。
(腫瘍学）CBCサンプリング
末梢血塗抹標本 - サンプリング
血液フィルム（末梢血塗抹標本）は、スライドガラスに薄く塗った血液を染色し、さまざまな血球を顕微鏡で観察できるようにしたものです。 \n\n必要な検査室: 血液検査室
末梢血塗抹標本 - 検査
血液フィルム（末梢血塗抹標本）は、スライドガラスに薄く塗った血液を染色し、さまざまな血球を顕微鏡で観察できるようにしたものです。
Liver Function Test Sampling

Liver function tests (also called LFTs) are blood tests that can provide information about how your liver is working. They test the levels of a number of proteins and enzymes that are either produced by liver cells or released into the blood when liver cells are damaged. \n\nRequired Lab: Haematology
Liver Function Test

Liver function tests (also called LFTs) are blood tests that can provide information about how your liver is working. They test the levels of a number of proteins and enzymes that are either produced by liver cells or released into the blood when liver cells are damaged.
F.I.S.H. Sampling

Fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) is a molecular cytogenetic technique that uses fluorescent probes that bind to only those parts of a nucleic acid sequence with a high degree of sequence complementarity. It was developed by biomedical researchers in the early 1980s to detect and localize the presence or absence of specific DNA sequences on chromosomes. Fluorescence microscopy can be used to find out where the fluorescent probe is bound to the chromosomes. FISH is often used for finding specific features in DNA for use in genetic counseling, medicine, and species identification. FISH can also be used to detect and localize specific RNA targets (mRNA, lncRNA and miRNA) in cells, circulating tumor cells, and tissue samples. \n\nRequired Lab: Histology
F.I.S.H. Test

Fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH) is a molecular cytogenetic technique that uses fluorescent probes that bind to only those parts of a nucleic acid sequence with a high degree of sequence complementarity. It was developed by biomedical researchers in the early 1980s to detect and localize the presence or absence of specific DNA sequences on chromosomes. Fluorescence microscopy can be used to find out where the fluorescent probe is bound to the chromosomes. FISH is often used for finding specific features in DNA for use in genetic counseling, medicine, and species identification. FISH can also be used to detect and localize specific RNA targets (mRNA, lncRNA and miRNA) in cells, circulating tumor cells, and tissue samples.
In Vitro Staining Sampling

Staining is a technique used to enhance contrast in samples, generally at the microscopic level. Stains and dyes are frequently used in histology (the study of tissue under the microscope) and in the medical fields of histopathology, hematology, and cytopathology that focus on the study and diagnoses disease at a microscopic level. Stains may be used to define biological tissues (highlighting, for example, muscle fibers or connective tissue), cell populations (classifying different blood cells), or organelles within individual cells. \n\nRequired Lab: Histology
In Vitro Staining Test

Staining is a technique used to enhance contrast in samples, generally at the microscopic level. Stains and dyes are frequently used in histology (the study of tissue under the microscope) and in the medical fields of histopathology, hematology, and cytopathology that focus on the study and diagnoses disease at a microscopic level. Stains may be used to define biological tissues (highlighting, for example, muscle fibers or connective tissue), cell populations (classifying different blood cells), or organelles within individual cells.
Mammogram
A mammogram is an X-ray of breast tissue that can find changes too small to be felt during a physical examination. \n\nRequired Room: X-Ray
Fine Needle Aspiration Sample

Fine needle aspiration is a quicker, less painful biopsy procedure to remove tissue, cell or fluid samples. In fine needle aspiration, a thin needle is inserted into an area of abnormal-appearing tissue or body fluid. As with other types of biopsies, the sample collected during fine needle aspiration can help make a diagnosis or rule out conditions such as cancer. \n\nRequired Lab: Histology
Fine Needle Aspiration Test

Fine needle aspiration is a quicker, less painful biopsy procedure to remove tissue, cell or fluid samples. In fine needle aspiration, a thin needle is inserted into an area of abnormal-appearing tissue or body fluid. As with other types of biopsies, the sample collected during fine needle aspiration can be used to help support a diagnosis.
Electron Microscopy Sample

Diagnostic Electron Microscopy is used as an important diagnostic tool to screen human tissues at high magnification (the ultrastructural level). For diagnostic purposes solid tissues are prepared for TEM in the same way as other biological tissues, they are fixed in glutaraldehyde and osmium tetroxide then dehydrated and embedded in epoxy resin. \n\nRequired Lab: Histology
Electron Microscopy Test

Diagnostic Electron Microscopy is used as an important diagnostic tool to screen human tissues at high magnification (the ultrastructural level). For diagnostic purposes solid tissues are prepared for TEM in the same way as other biological tissues, they are fixed in glutaraldehyde and osmium tetroxide then dehydrated and embedded in epoxy resin.
Pelvic Exam
A pelvic exam is a doctor's visual and physical examination of a woman's reproductive organs. During the exam, the doctor inspects the vagina, cervix, fallopian tubes, vulva, ovaries, and uterus.
Digital Rectal Exam (DRE)
A digital rectal exam (DRE) is a test for both men and women. It allows a doctor to check the lower rectum, pelvis, and lower belly for cancer and other health problems like prostate cancer.
Comprehensive Mineral Panel Sampling

The Comprehensive Mineral Panel includes testing the blood for five minerals and is used to detect deficiencies or overexposure (toxicity) across the mineral spectrum. This panel includes testing levels of the following five minerals: Calcium, Copper, Magnesium, Manganese and Zinc. \n\nRequired Lab: Haematology
Comprehensive Mineral Panel Test

The Comprehensive Mineral Panel includes testing the blood for five minerals and is used to detect deficiencies or overexposure (toxicity) across the mineral spectrum. This panel includes testing levels of the following five minerals: Calcium, Copper, Magnesium, Manganese and Zinc.
Lymph Node Biopsy Sampling

Lymph node biopsy is a test in which a lymph node or a piece of a lymph node is removed for examination under a microscope. A lymph node biopsy can help determine if the patient has an infection, an immune disorder, or cancer. \n\nRequired Lab: Histology
Lymph Node Biopsy Test

Lymph node biopsy is a test in which a lymph node or a piece of a lymph node is removed for examination under a microscope. A lymph node biopsy can help determine if the patient has an infection, an immune disorder, or cancer.
Colonoscopy Biopsy Sampling

A colonoscopy is a medical procedure that is done to look for cancer, colon polyps or other abnormalities inside your bowel. Colonoscopy is done using an instrument called a colonoscope (a type of endoscope) — a long, thin, flexible tube containing a camera and a light. During the colonoscopy, the doctor passes an instrument through the colonoscope to obtain a biopsy (a small sample of the colon lining) to be further analysed.
Colonoscopy Biopsy Testing

A colonoscopy is a medical procedure that is done to look for cancer, colon polyps or other abnormalities inside your bowel. Colonoscopy is done using an instrument called a colonoscope (a type of endoscope) — a long, thin, flexible tube containing a camera and a light. During the colonoscopy, the doctor passes an instrument through the colonoscope to obtain a biopsy (a small sample of the colon lining) to be further analysed.
Liver Biopsy Sampling

A liver biopsy is a procedure in which a small needle is inserted into the liver to collect a tissue sample. The tissue is then analysed in a laboratory to help doctors diagnose a variety of disorders and diseases in the liver. \n\nRequired Lab: Histology
Liver Biopsy Testing

A liver biopsy is a procedure in which a small needle is inserted into the liver to collect a tissue sample. The tissue is then analysed in a laboratory to help doctors diagnose a variety of disorders and diseases in the liver.
